input_parameters.name: user_id
input_parameters.description: The ID of the user to send a message to

input_parameters.name: message
input_parameters.description: The textual message to send as a direct message
examples: You've been swallowed by a grue.

input_parameters.name: thread_ts
input_parameters.description: The `ts` identifier of an _existing_ message to [send this message to as a reply](/surfaces/messages#threading).

input_parameters.name: metadata
input_parameters.description: Additional [metadata](/metadata/publishing) about the message, which can then be used an [workflow event trigger](/automation/triggers/event).

input_parameters.name: interactive_blocks
input_parameters.description: [Buttons](/reference/block-kit/block-elements#button__fields) to send with the message. Must be wrapped in a block.

output_parameters.description: The channel-specific unique identifier for this message, also serves as a confirmation that the message was sent.
output_parameters.name: message_ts
message_context
output_parameters.description: An individual instance of the message you sent
Permalink URL of the message that was sent
output_parameters.name: message_link

output_parameters.description: If `interactive_blocks` was provided, the action object contains the [button](/reference/block-kit/block-elements#button__fields) properties (see [action payload](#action-payload) below)
output_parameters.name: action

output_parameters.description: If `interactive_blocks` is provided as an input parameter, the [interactivity](/automation/interactivity) context becomes available
output_parameters.name: interactivity
